The land bridges described here are a good step but they don't address the bigger issue which is over-development itself and all of the waste produced in the process. Construction is the biggest polluter by far! Not only does it use an incredible amount fossil fuels, it also disrupts local climates, displaces animals and upsets food chains, drains water tables, essentially anything in the natural world that has at it's core purpose to renew and replenish resources. Just think of the oxygen produced in a forest, and then think how much is not produced by asphalt and concrete. So not only does mass-scale development create waste, it also destroys the ability to deal with the waste produced.
